intro: Coccoloba buchii, commonly known as the red mangrove or red mangrove fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in coastal and brackish water environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red, waxy leaves that provide protection against saltwater and intense sunlight. It has small, inconspicuous flowers and produces fruit that is dispersed by water. Coccoloba buchii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
